title: Anivia, OP?

replies.body:
#"Complaining about a problem without proposing a solution is called whining."

######-Teddy Roosevelt

Nice quote, but it has nothing to with me. I posed a question so others could opine with their experience and thoughts on Anivia. The fact that in your egoism you misconstrued it to mean I was whining says a lot about you. I would appreciate it if you never comment on my posts from here on out. Thank you.

_Looks very hard over post_

_Sees only one question while the rest is complaints_

Well I still think you're whining.
Okay wonderful. Nobody cares what you think. Take your self important ego somewhere else.
Not anymore. That time has passed.
Because Anivia is rarely played, so those who do, are experienced players. Add to lack of exposure from enemies, Anivia players have the advantage to wreck them.
Anivia has the lowest (or one of the lowest) base health in the game to make up  for her passive. She needs her Q to actually 100-0 you though, but it's one of the slowest projectiles in the game.

> And yet, whenever I see her in a match its like 90% for sure shes going to wreck house.

Not a lot of people play her , 4 to be exact. So basically , every time that you face a Anivia , there's a 25% chance that you are up against Froggen
And the rest of the time it's a main :P

The reason why Anivia has high AP ratios (well, not her ultimate, it's horrible) is that they're very hard to get both "ticks" of the ratios off. You will almost never hit both ticks of her Q, thus giving it a 40% scaling per tick. You will only get both "ticks" of her E off based on the situation, so therefore they have high scaling.
Anivia feeds off the misplaced positioning of Wood Vs.
